data.title: Fantastic Pizza & Gelato
data.text: This pizza is great, no really.  Perfect crust, nice smokey flavor to it combined with the right toppings- makes for a great combination.  We love this place and make it a point to go everytime we are in Flagstaff.  Do not pass up the gelato!  Inventive and yummy flavors.

data.title: Yummy artisan pizza
data.text: This place has wonderful pizza.  The crust is amazing.  Get here early on the weekend to get a seat.  It fills up fast.  Save room for the gelato- it is crazy good.

data.title: Authentic Italian Pizza
data.text: Best pizza I've had since my last trip to Italy. Simple, fresh salad. Complimentary sparkling water. Tiny seating area, but I believe they serve to the brewery next door. Thanks for a great dinner! Awesome service.

data.title: Delicious Pizza
data.text: The pizza was amazing! Delicious thin crust and tasty ingredients, almost like a true Italian pizza! The staff was super-friendly and the service was fast. We also tasted the home-made ice cream (gelato) which was fabulous. We loved the atmosphere and the nice long table! We would definitely visit again!

data.title: Heard A Rumor About Authentic Italian Pizza In Flagstaff AZ
data.text:
I was in Maryville TN, (small southern town) talking to a friend of mine from Indiana when the subject of pizza came up.  She told me that a guy I had attended high school with had opened a little pizzeria in Flagstaff AZ that had received accolades as one of the best authentic Italian pizza places in the US.  Apparently he was in Italy that very week in search new wines and ideas for his little joint in Flagstaff.

Now... when you are sitting next to a campfire in the the Tennessee woods, and a lifelong friend from Indiana tells you about a great place for authentic Italian pizza in the sleepy mountain town 2 hours north of Scottsdale AZ, where you live...  If you are me, you get your butt up to Flagstaff and check this supposed gem out.  That's exactly what I did.

I loved the tiny interior which consisted of a long communal table and about 6 bar stools for counter top seating.  The menu is charming in it's simplicity.  We had the cheese plate, house red wine (from Italy of course), and shared a pizza.  It was phenomenal.  Simple food made from simple ingredients that was clearly constructed with attention to detail, tradition, and care.

When you hear a rumor about good food in interesting circumstances... It's always best to check it out.  Pizzicletta is definitely the real thing.

data.title: Ammmmazing pizza
data.text: I'm a pizza fanatic and usually eat at Grimaldis, Bianco, Lou malnatis etc. this place was Perfect. We ordered a bottle of wine, house salad and shared a pizza. The margarita with chiles and ground meat which I think was sausage. While very spicey we are the whole thing. Yum I'll be back as that was my second time.

data.title: Delicious pizza in the middle of nowhere!
data.text: I was on the way to the Grand Canyon from L.A. and I stopped in Flagstaff for a quick bite and a few hours of sleep. I bumped into this place by accident and I couldn't believe there was a proper woodfire oven.. so I decided to walk in and it was the best decision: the pizza is absolutely delicious, light and fluffy, with delicious ingredients. the dough and the cooking is done as an Italian pizzaiolo would do it. I definitely recommend it if you are in the area!

data.title: What a great find
data.text: This is a quaint and charming pizza place. Our hotel staff recommended it and they were right on spot . We started with the antipasti as an appetizer and it was wonderful. The margarita pizza we ordered was also just as fabulous. This place is small so seating is limited. We were lucky to get there before they got too busy. Very reasonable prices.

data.title: Pizza Special
data.text:
Unique & delicious!!  I will make it a point to come here EVERY time I visit Flagstaff
Be sure to get there early to get a place in line... tiny place w/ limited seating... worth it though.

data.title: Great stop to page
data.text: Drove from Phoenix to flagstaff and stopped here for a quick dinner. Between 4 people we split two whole pies. Decent pizza though the  joint is a bit small.

data.title: The best Pizza in a competitive Flagstaff market
data.text: Not only is the pizza authentic Italian style made in a great 900 degree oven, the crust is thin puffy perfection.  The vibe is casual, hipster, and cute.  The angled corner building that houses the restaurant is legitimised by great plates, water goblets and real pizza knives...oh, good background music.  Not for the domino's lovers..

data.title: Gourmet pizza
data.text:
My wife and I had their pizza twice while visiting Flagstaff. The first time we ordered from the Mother road brewery. I had one if their pizzas without tomato sauce and with Arugula. It was very good. My wife had an appetizer with fresh mozzarella, apricots, and their bread. She loved it.
The second time we ate it there and we had the Margherita pizza with an italian salami added. I wanted to try one with tomato sauce and it was delicious. This is a smaller pie, but it satisfied my wife and I. We also each had a different beer. My only complaint would be the lack of beer choices. My wife and I both like stouts and porters and they did not have any on their limited menu. They only had an IPA from the Mother road brewery...we assumed they had their full menu. 
The pizza came really fast, because the pizza ovens cooks them at 900 F, so it is very fast. We also finished the meal each time with their Gelato...which is I must say AWESOME! Do NOT leave without ordering this amazing Italian ice cream. Luckily, the pizza will not leave you stuffed if you only eat half a pie.

data.title: Amazing every night!
data.text: The pizza here is some of the best I have ever had in the nation. The commitment to detail, quality and creativity with the pizza of the day makes Pizzicletta a special place. The quality of the dough is a testament to the high-level craft which is practiced here, as is the homemade and local ingredients used. The wine selection is a delight to pour through and is rotating at a relatively fast pace, enough so that I'm disappointed when a bottle runs out, yet excited to turn my attention to a new-to-me bottle. Variety is the spice of life! Lastly, the staff is super welcoming, knowledgeable and passionate not only about the offerings within the walls of Pizzicletta, but about the city and regional activities which abound in Northern Arizona. Not visiting Pizzicletta when in Flagstaff would be a mistake!

data.title: FANTASTIC
data.text: We had great experience. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The food was delicious and we would definitely go back. We loved sitting at the community table.

data.title: Best pizza place in Flagstaff.
data.text: Small, intimate restaurant with family style seating.  Without a doubt the BEST pizza in Flagstaff.  You won't be disappointed.  If the place is packed, you can order pizza at a takeaway window on the street, or go to the brewery next door where you can order pizza off the menu and Pizziletta will bring deliver it to you to eat while you are having a beer.

data.title: This place is amazing!
data.text: If you've ever traveled to Italy you know their pizza is like no other. Well I'm here to tell you this is pretty darn close to the real thing! It's awesome and shouldn't be missed!

data.title: If the daughter says it's good, it's GOOD
data.text: Like a lot of shops, restaurants and cafes in Flagstaff it's a little bohemian / quirky in a really good way, no frills dining but it's pizza and the BEST pizza I've tasted, not a massive choice but freshly prepared salads and pizza in front of your eyes at a great price. wouldn't hesitate in going back and would defo recommend. Superb service and quality food.

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: This was perfect - great pizza (seriously great?); brilliant gelato for dessert; delicious beer from the brewery next door; and supremely friendly staff. A 'must' if you travel to Flagstaff.

data.title: Super Tasty
data.text: Great wine, even better pizza, and a fun atmosphere! Everything was fresh and delicious. Pizza special last Saturday was amazing.  We even brought our kids, and they adapted a simple pizza for the two of them.  We sat inside on the end of a community-style table setting. Kids could watch the pizza being made, which was a bonus for them.  We loved this place and will definitely go back.  As well as our visit went, whether or not this place is "kid friendly" would depend on your family and your expectations. Our children are 5 and 7, and were well behaved. Inside, you'll be in close quarters with other diners, so children staying in seats is a must. (Our family arrived well after dark, so maybe they have outdoor seating available that we didn't see?) While the servers were welcoming, some other guests frowned at us for bringing out children. This is a great place for food and friends, and I don't see any reason we couldn't return as a family for more tasty food.

data.title: Party in my mouth!
data.text: We loved everything about Pizzicletta! The way we ordered at Mother Road brewery by lifting the flag on the metal gear junk menu holder, the great service, the delicious margarita pizza with chilis and prosciutto, the ginger lemon and pistachio cardamom gelato - every last bit and bite of our experience we excellent.
